cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.MM

Reasoning: The paper proposes an information theoretic approach to solve the secret sharing problem, which involves secure communication over noisy channels. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) category. Additionally, the paper deals with security and cryptography, which are also relevant to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) category. The paper also involves coding and decoding techniques, which are relevant to the Coding Theory and Error Correction (cs.CC) category. The paper also involves multi-input multi-output (MIMO) channels, which are relevant to the Signal Processing (cs.SI) category. Finally, the paper involves layered decoding and secrecy constraints, which are relevant to the Multimedia (cs.MM) category.
